intro: Odontites lanceolatus var. sventenii, commonly known as the Sventen's narrow-leaved toothcup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, lanceolate leaves with a hairy surface and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
